tit.e: Kyoto Higashiyama Hanatoro (path with flowers and lanterns)
tit.cmt: 京都・東山花灯路→Kyoto Higashiyama Hana Toroを、Kyoto Higashiyama Hanatoro (path with flowers and lanterns)にしてみました。
tit.e: Kyoto Higashiyama Hanatoro (path with flowers and lanterns)
Kyoto Higashiyama Hanatoro (path with flowers and lanterns)

sen.j: 京都・東山花灯路（きょうと・ひがしやまはなとうろ）は、3月中旬に京都の東山 (京都府)山麓の青蓮院から清水寺に至る約4.6キロの小路に京都の伝統工芸である清水焼、北山杉、京銘竹、石工、金属などで作られた約2400基の行灯を点し、夜の散策を楽しむ趣向の、早春を告げる観光イベントである。
sen.e: "Kyoto Higashiyama Hana Toro" refers to a touristic event to herald the arrival of early spring in the middle of March, that about 2400 lanterns, which are made by Kiyomizu ceramics (traditional handicrafts in Kyoto), Kitayamasugi round cedar wood, Kyomei bamboo, stone art and metal art, are lit on the narrow path for about 4.6 km from Shoren-in Temple to Kiyomizu-dera Temple at the foothills of Higashiyama Mountain of Kyoto to enjoy an evening walk.
sen.cmt: 青蓮院はShorei-inでなくShoren-inと修正。
sen.e: "Kyoto Higashiyama Hana Toro" refers to a touristic event to herald the arrival of early spring in the middle of March, that about 2400 lanterns, which are made by Kiyomizu ceramics (traditional handicrafts in Kyoto), Kitayamasugi round cedar wood, Kyomei bamboo, stone art and metal art, are lit on the narrow path for about 4.6 km from Shoren-in Temple to Kiyomizu-dera Temple at the foothills of Higashiyama Mountain of Kyoto to enjoy an evening walk.

Kyoto Higashiyama Hana Toro refers to a touristic event to herald the arrival of early spring in the middle of March, that about 2400 lanterns, which are made by Kiyomizu ceramics (traditional handicrafts in Kyoto), Kitayamasugi round cedar wood, Kyomei bamboo, stone art and metal art, are lit on the narrow path for about 4.6 km from Shoren-in Temple to Kiyomizu-dera Temple at the foot of Higashiyama mountain range of Kyoto to enjoy an evening walk.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除、at the foothills of Higashiyama Mountain→at the foot of Higashiyama mountain rangeとしました。

sen.j: 比較的、観光客の多い日中と異なり、夜の京都は地元や宿泊客などの一部に知られるものの、寺社のほとんどは拝観時間の制限もあり、繁華街を除けば東山周辺の小路などが散策の対象になることは少なかった。
sen.e: Though Kyoto at night have been known by some people such as local people and hotel guests, different from the daytime with relatively high number of tourists, a narrow path in and around Higashiyama had never been a place to walk except downtown areas, partly because of the limit of opening hours of most temples and shrines.

Though Kyoto at night have been known by some people such as local people and hotel guests, different from the daytime with relatively high number of tourists, a narrow path in and around Higashiyama had never been a place to walk except downtown areas, partly because of the limit of opening hours of most temples and shrines.

Though Kyoto at night have been known by some people such as local people and hotel guests, different from the daytime with relatively high number of tourists, a narrow path in and around Higashiyama had never been a place to walk except downtown areas, partly because of the limit of opening hours of most temples and shrines.

sen.j: 2003年から始まった当イベントは、わずか10日間ほどではあるが、夜の京都の情緒や雰囲気を味わえるイベントとして定着し、毎年100万人以上の人出で賑わっている。
sen.e: This event, having started since 2003, is held only for 10 days, but has been well established as an event where you can enjoy the impression and atmosphere of Kyoto at night, and attracts more than a million people each year.

This event, having started since 2003, is held only for 10 days, but has been well established as an event where you can enjoy the impression and atmosphere of Kyoto at night, and attracts more than a million people each year.

This event, having started since 2003, is held only for 10 days, but has been well established as an event where you can enjoy the impression and atmosphere of Kyoto at night, and attracts more than a million people each year.

sen.j: 北は神宮道から青蓮院に始まり、知恩院、円山公園、八坂神社、神幸道などを経由し、大雲院 (京都市)祇園閣を眺め圓徳院、高台寺、ねねの道、一年坂、二年坂から清水寺までの行路の足元を仄かに照らすさまざまな行灯や催し物を見ながら歩く人々の群れで、早春の東山はしばし賑わい、幻想的な色合いに包まれる。
sen.e: Higashiyama in the early spring is enveloped by a fantastic atmosphere, briefly attracting people, who walk, while seeing some events and various lanterns illuminating faintly their feet on the path, starting from Jingumichi road and Shoren-in Temple in the north, via Chion-in Temple, Maruyama Park, Yasaka-jinja Shrine and Shinkomichi road, viewing Daiun-in Temple Gion-kaku (Kyoto), to Entoku-in, Kodai-ji Temple, Nene Road, Ichinenzaka slope, Ninenzaka slope, and Kiyomizu-dera Temple.

Higashiyama in the early spring is enveloped by a fantastic atmosphere, briefly attracting people, who walk, while seeing some events and various lanterns illuminating faintly their feet on the path, starting from Jingumichi road and Shoren-in Temple in the north, via Chion-in Temple, Maruyama Park, Yasaka-jinja Shrine and Shinkomichi road, viewing Daiun-in Temple Gion-kaku (Kyoto), to Entoku-in, Kodai-ji Temple, Nene Road, Ichinenzaka slope, Ninenzaka slope, and Kiyomizu-dera Temple.

Higashiyama in the early spring is enveloped by a fantastic atmosphere, briefly attracting people, who walk, while seeing some events and various lanterns illuminating faintly their feet on the path, starting from Jingumichi road and Shoren-in Temple in the north, via Chion-in Temple, Maruyama Park, Yasaka-jinja Shrine and Shinkomichi road, viewing Daiun-in Temple Gion-kaku (Kyoto), to Entoku-in, Kodai-ji Temple, Nene no Michi (The Path of Nene), Ichinenzaka slope, Ninenzaka slope, and Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: Nene Road→Nene no Michi (The Path of Nene) としました。(参照: http://www.japanvisitor.com/index.php?cID=432&pID=1875)

sen.j: 1．灯りと花の路（青蓮院から清水寺の散策路）点灯時間 午後6時～午後9時30分
sen.e: 1. Lighting hours of the path of light and flowers (walking path from Shoren-in to Kiyomizu-dera Temple): 6:00 PM to 9:30 PM
1. Lighting hours of the path of light and flowers (walking path from Shoren-in to Kiyomizu-dera Temple): 6:00 PM to 9:30 PM
1. Lighting hours of the path of light and flowers (walking path from Shoren-in to Kiyomizu-dera Temple): 6:00 PM to 9:30 PM
3. Bamboo light, River of profundity (Maruyama Park)
sen.cmt: 竹灯り、幽玄の川→bamboo light, river of the subtle and profoundは、Bamboo light, River of profundityにしました。
sen.e: 3. Bamboo light, River of profundity (Maruyama Park)
3. Bamboo light, River of profundity (Maruyama Park)

sen.cmt: 現代いけばな展（円山公園）→Contenporary Ikebana exhibitsは、綴り間違いを、Contemporaryに修正。

sen.j: 5．大学のまち京都・伝統の灯り展（円山公園）
sen.e: 5. Academic city Kyoto, Traditional light exhibits (Maruyama Park)
5. Academic city Kyoto, Traditional light exhibits (Maruyama Park)
5. Academic city Kyoto, Traditional light exhibits (Maruyama Park)

6. Geisha town, Geisha parade, Rickshaw parade
6. Geisha town, Geisha parade, Rickshaw parade

sen.j: 7．火の用心、お囃子組（清水寺付近）
sen.cmt: 火の用心、お囃子組→Beware of fire, music teamをFire patrol, Musci teamにしました。
sen.e: 7. Fire Patrol, Music team (around the Kiyomizu-dera Temple)

sen.j: 行灯の設置される地区

sen.cmt: 他の「○○道」と同様、Kachomichi roadとしました。
下河原(しもがわら)道→Shimogawaramichi roadに修正

sen.j: ライトアップ（以下の各寺社では期間中、特別拝観とライトアップが行われる）
sen.e: Lighting up (the temples and shrines below are lit up and have special admission during the event)
Lighting up (the temples and shrines below are lit up and have special admission during the event)

Kyoto Chamber of Commerce and Industry

sen.cmt: 京都文化交流コンベンションビューロー→Kyoto Cinvention Bureau [http://hellokcb.or.jp/]の綴り間違いをConventionに修正

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄東西線 東山駅 (京都府)下車 約10分
sen.e: About 10 minutes from Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line Higashiyama-station
About 10 minutes from Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line Higashiyama-station
About 10 minutes from Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line Higashiyama Station

sen.j: 京都市営バスおよび京阪バス 五条坂下車 徒歩10分
sen.e: About 10-minute walk from Kyoto City Bus and Keihan Bus Gojozaka Station
sen.cmt: 京都市営バスおよび京阪バス 五条坂→Kyoto City Bus and Keiha Bus Gojozaka Stationの、KeihaはKeihanに修正。
sen.e: About 10-minute walk from Kyoto City Bus and Keihan Bus Gojozaka Station
About 10-minute walk from Kyoto City Bus and Keihan Bus Gojozaka Station

sen.j: 開催期間中は駐車場は混雑するため、公共交通機関を利用。
sen.e: Since parking places are crowded during the event, using public transportation is recommended.
Since parking places are crowded during the event, using public transportation is recommended.
